name: Account abstraction for a private network
description:
Account abstraction has opened the door to gasless transactions, 
alternative authentication methods, social recovery, app accounts, and 
other innovations. However, it imposes in additional strain in the 
protocol, as validation is no longer a straightforward process. 

In
 this talk, we'll explore how working on a private-first network such as
 Aztec expands what's possible to do with account abstraction, as well 
as some new challenges that arise from it.

speakers.name: Santiago Palladino
speakers.bio: MSc Computer Science from University of Buenos Aires. Been coding professionally for 18+ years, and joined the web3 space 6 years ago. Councilmember for The Graph and Technical mentor at Zeitgeist. Previously at OpenZeppelin and Manas.tech. Author of "Ethereum for Web Developers" book.
